shortdesc.ph: Information related to the media file to be played and the playback scenario configurations.

p.codeblock: public abstract int joinChannelEx(String token, RtcConnection connection, ChannelMediaOptions options, IRtcEngineEventHandler eventHandler);

- (int)joinChannelExByToken:(NSString* _Nullable)token connection:(AgoraRtcConnection * _Nonnull)connection delegate:(id<AgoraRtcEngineDelegate> _Nullable)delegate mediaOptions:(AgoraRtcChannelMediaOptions* _Nonnull)mediaOptions joinSuccess:(void(^ _Nullable)(NSString* _Nonnull channel, NSUInteger uid, NSInteger elapsed))joinSuccessBlock;
public abstract int JoinChannelEx(string token, RtcConnection connection, ChannelMediaOptions options);
Future<void> joinChannelEx( {required String token, required RtcConnection connection, required ChannelMediaOptions options});

pd.p: The URL of the media file to be played.

note.ph: If you need to open a custom media resource, you do not have to pass in a value to the url.

plentry.pd: The starting position (ms) for playback. The default value is 0.

Whether to enable autoplay once the media file is opened:
: (Default) Enable autoplay.
: Disable autoplay.
If autoplay is disabled, you need to call the method to play a media file after it is opened.

Whether to cache the media file when it is being played:
:Enable caching.
: (Default) Disable caching.
If you need to enable caching, pass in a value to uri; otherwise, caching is based on the url of the media file.
If you enable this function, the Media Player caches part of the media file being played on your local device, and you can play the cached media file without internet connection. The statistics about the media file being cached are updated every second after the media file is played. See .

Whether the media resource to be opened is a live stream or on-demand video distributed through Media Broadcast service:
: The media resource is a live stream or on-demand video distributed through Media Broadcast service.
: The media resource is not a live stream or on-demand video distributed through Media Broadcast service.
If you need to open a live stream or on-demand video distributed through Broadcast Streaming service, pass in the URL of the media resource to url, and set isAgoraSource as ; otherwise, you don't need to set the isAgoraSource parameter.

Whether the media resource to be opened is a live stream:
: The media resource is a live stream.
: (Default) The media resource is not a live stream.
If the media resource you want to open is a live stream, Agora recommends that you set this parameter as so that the live stream can be loaded more quickly.
If the media resource you open is not a live stream, but you set isLiveSource as , the media resource is not to be loaded more quickly.

pd.p: The callback for custom media resource files. See .

note.p: If you need to open a custom media resource, such as an encrypted media file, pass in a value to provider rather than to url.

pd.p: Occurs when the SDK reads the media resource data. See .

note.p: If you need to open a custom media resource, such as an encrypted media file, pass in values to playerOnReadCallback and playerOnSeekCallback instead of to url.

pd.p: Occurs when the SDK seeks the media resource data. See .
